title: Loomis–Whitney inequality
summary: In mathematics, the Loomis–Whitney inequality is a result in geometry, which in its simplest form, allows one to estimate the "size" of a d {\displaystyle d} -dimensional set by the sizes of its ( d − 1 ) {\displaystyle (d-1)} -dimensional projections. The inequality has applications in incidence geometry, the study of so-called "lattice animals", and other areas.
